English.Text: Faith steadies the soldier's hand as he approaches the bride, but then he stops abruptly. "You should see your faces!" cackles a dimunitive and smartly-dressed man, emerging from the shadows. Suddenly the room fills with electric light. "I'm Jean-Eug√®ne Poivre, and this little beauty is my proudest invention." He winks and twists the bride's head one-hundred and eighty degrees. The automaton is in so lifelike, it chills your men even now. They do not take well to learning the illusionist has been toying with them, and leave early the following morning, still very upset.
